page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO PETROCKSTOWE
page.content: {Petrockstowe}village lies among hills on a side road off the A386 from Gt. Torrington to Hatherleigh,equidistant 6 miles. It has 300 people (25% chil- dren) over{half}of them{Devon born. There are 2 Churches, a public house, petrol station, Post Office/stores & a modern village hall, but no school. There are old cob/thatch houses and modern bungalows, mains water & elec- tricity & 75% have a telephone. Clay lorries from nearby Peters Marland clay works pass through twice daily, 2/3 times a week & contribute finan- cially to ensure road maintenance above normal village standards. Milk tankers too use the road daily as this is largely a{farming area,}although other employment ranges from a village blacksmith's forge to shipyard worker at Appledore. There is neither doctor nor dentist in the survey area.
